did.abstract: Residents of Calhoun and Lenawee counties, Michigan. Family letters and documents.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Homer D. Strong and family (donor no. 7586) and came to the library in various accessions, 1988-1991.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Mitchell-Strong family papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Mitchell and Strong families were long-time residents of Calhoun and Lenawee Counties in Michigan.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of family letters preserved by Betsey Mitchell Strong and donated to the Michigan Historical Collections by her grandson Homer Dennis Strong. The collection consists of approximately 1400 family letters and documents covering the period of 1836 to 1925 and three volumes of transcriptions of the documents made by Doris Boldt.

The collection is maintained in numbered envelopes in approximate chronological order. In 1988, the library received a first accession of some 440 letters with a register of these letters compiled by Doris Boldt. This register included document number, date, recipient, sender, and notes about contents.

In 1990, Mr. Strong donated nearly 1000 additional letters and documents with typed transcriptions of the collection made by Doris Boldt. In the two year interim since the first accession, however, Boldt had created a new numbering sequence for the collection. This numbers refer to the pages of the transcription volumes. Once again, Boldt provided a register to letters. This register includes both original numbers and revised numbers.

did.unittitle: Register of letters, including date, recipient, sender, brief notation about content

note.p: (see register in box 1 to translate original number into revised numbering sequence)
